intro: Pontania celsiana, commonly known as the Celsian rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to rocky, coastal environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
